coffee_leaf_rust.name: Coffee Leaf Rust
coffee_leaf_rust.description: Caused by the fungus Hemileia vastatrix. Orange-yellow spots appear on the underside of the leaves, causing early leaf drop and reduced yield.
coffee_leaf_rust.solution: Regularly spray with Mancozeb or Copper Hydroxide. Prune and destroy infected leaves, and keep the plantation well-ventilated.

durian_algal_leaf.name: Algal Leaf Disease in Durian
durian_algal_leaf.description: Reddish-brown or orange spots appear on the leaves, caused by the alga Cephaleuros virescens.
durian_algal_leaf.solution: Prune affected leaves and spray with a copper-based fungicide.

durian_allocaridara_attack.name: Durian Damaged by Allocaridara Insects
durian_allocaridara_attack.description: Allocaridara insects damage young leaf tissues and cause leaf edges to curl.
durian_allocaridara_attack.solution: Use selective biological or chemical insecticides. Monitor regularly.

durian_leaf_blight.name: Durian Leaf Blight
durian_leaf_blight.description: Leaf edges are scorched and dry either partially or completely, often caused by fungi or adverse environmental conditions.
durian_leaf_blight.solution: Water appropriately, improve ventilation. Apply antifungal spray if necessary.

durian_phomopsis_leaf_spot.name: Phomopsis Leaf Spot on Durian
durian_phomopsis_leaf_spot.description: Caused by Phomopsis spp. fungi, creating black circular spots on leaves, which may lead to leaf drop.
durian_phomopsis_leaf_spot.solution: Remove infected leaves and apply fungicides containing carbendazim or mancozeb.

lemon_deficiency_leaf.name: Nutrient Deficiency in Lemon Leaves
lemon_deficiency_leaf.description: Leaves appear pale yellow with green veins, caused by deficiencies in nitrogen, iron, or magnesium.
lemon_deficiency_leaf.solution: Apply balanced fertilizers. Use foliar fertilizers containing micronutrients.

lemon_leaf_anthracnose.name: Anthracnose on Lemon Leaves
lemon_leaf_anthracnose.description: Caused by Colletotrichum spp. fungi. Leaves develop brown, slightly sunken spots that expand over time.
lemon_leaf_anthracnose.solution: Prune diseased branches and leaves. Spray with copper-based fungicides or azoxystrobin.

lemon_spider_mite_leaf.name: Lemon Leaves Attacked by Spider Mites
lemon_spider_mite_leaf.description: Spider mites suck sap from the leaves, causing yellowing, drying, and leaf drop.
lemon_spider_mite_leaf.solution: Use high-pressure water to wash off mites. Apply biological miticides or abamectin.

coffee_leaf_red_spider_mite.name: Coffee Leaves Infested by Red Spider Mites
coffee_leaf_red_spider_mite.description: Red spider mites damage the underside of the leaves, forming yellow spots that reduce photosynthesis and yield.
coffee_leaf_red_spider_mite.solution: Keep soil moisture adequate, spray miticides like abamectin at the right time.
